rules.natural: If sound equipment is available for filming, then camera equipment is not available for filming.
Whenever lighting equipment is available for filming, it has been tested for proper functioning.
If editing is completed by the deadline, then post-production is not completed on schedule.
Delivery of the final episode to the network occurs only if editing is completed by the deadline.
Given that the producers authorized the overtime budget, if either the script is not ready for filming or filming is not scheduled for studio time, then the final episode is delivered to the network.
Either the producers authorized the overtime budget, or the network executive authorized the overtime budget.
Should the network executive authorize the overtime budget, then if the script is not ready for filming or filming is not scheduled for studio time, the final episode is delivered to the network.
For filming to be scheduled for studio time, camera equipment must be available.
When filming is scheduled for studio time, lighting equipment is available.

Either the grievance with the production crew is resolved, or if the union does not approve extended filming hours and either the script is not ready or filming is not scheduled, then no grievance is filed by the production crew.
Whenever the show violates content guidelines, it is not compliant with broadcasting standards.
If the producers approve the final cut, then the network also approves the final cut.
Should the producers approve the final cut, then it is not the case that the network approves the final cut.
Either the producers approve the final cut, or the script is ready for filming, or filming is not scheduled for studio time.
Whenever the producers submit a renewal proposal, the network reviews it.
Provided that the network reviews the renewal proposal, the show is not renewed for the next season.
If it is not true that testing the lighting equipment for proper functioning implies sound equipment availability, then the producers approve alternative lighting.
Under the condition that testing the lighting equipment for proper functioning does not necessitate sound equipment availability, the producers do not approve alternative lighting.
If the union does not approve extended filming hours and either the script is not ready or filming is not scheduled, then the production crew files a grievance.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(submitted(producers, appeal_decision) | (-greenlit(show, production) -> violated(show, content_guidelines))) -> upheld(appeal, review_board))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that either the producers submit an appeal decision or the show not being greenlit implies a content violation, then the appeal is upheld by the review board.
Provided that it is false that either the producers submit an appeal decision or non-greenlighting leads to a content violation, the appeal is not upheld by the review board.
If the script is not ready for filming or filming is not scheduled for studio time, then post-production is completed on schedule.
If it is not true that the show not being greenlit implies the budget committee did not approve the pilot episode, then filming is scheduled for studio time.
Provided that it is false that the show not being greenlit leads to non-compliance with broadcasting standards, the show is renewed for the next season.
Under the condition that the show not being greenlit does not imply non-compliance, the producers submit a renewal proposal.
Should the show not be greenlit for production, then it is compliant with broadcasting standards.
